alert.note: Alert for Coastal Rockingham (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued December 17 at 3:17AM EST until December 18 at 6:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Storm surge values of 2-3ft and large nearshore waves of 15-20ft may coincide with the Monday afternoon high tide to bring minor to moderate coastal flooding impacts. * WHERE...In Maine, Coastal York County. In New Hampshire, Coastal Rockingham County. * WHEN...Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads may be closed. Low lying property including homes, businesses, and some critical infrastructure may be inundated. Some shoreline erosion may occur. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Seavey Island / Portsmouth NH MLLW Categories - Minor 11.5 ft, Moderate 12.5 ft, Major 13.5 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 2.7 ft, Moderate 3.7 ft, Major 4.7 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 17/02 PM 9.9 1.1 0.7 2-3 None 18/03 AM 9.1 0.3 1.0 4-6 None 18/03 PM 11.0 2.2 2.1 13-16 None 19/04 AM 8.1 -0.7 -0.1 11-12 None 19/04 PM 8.8 -0.0 0.2 9-10 None Hampton Harbor NH MLLW Categories - Minor 11.0 ft, Moderate 12.0 ft, Major 13.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.5 ft, Moderate 2.5 ft, Major 3.5 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 17/02 PM 10.1 0.6 0.7 1 None 18/03 AM 9.3 -0.2 1.0 2 None 18/03 PM 11.1 1.6 2.0 3-4 Minor 19/04 AM 8.3 -1.2 -0.1 3 None 19/04 PM 9.0 -0.5 0.2 3 None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
